publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3680 Carolyn Leckie: Congratulations to John Aberdein—That the Parliament congratulates John Aberdein for winning the Saltire Society/Royal Mail Scottish First Book of the Year Award for Amande’s Bed;believes that this book marks an important milestone in promoting the dialects and languages of Scotland and in enriching Scotland’s culture, and believes that Scottish literary works should be encouraged, promoted and protected from big business interests which undermine diversity and lead to the encroachment of a monoculture. Supported by: Frances Curran*, Tommy Sheridan*, Richard Lochhead*, Colin Fox*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-3680 Congratulations to John Aberdein (lodged on 6 December 2005) Chris Ballance*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-3680 Congratulations to John Aberdein (lodged on 6 December 2005) Mr Jim Wallace*, Michael Matheson*

S2M-3680 Carolyn Leckie: Congratulations to John Aberdein—That the Parliament congratulates John Aberdein for winning the Saltire Society/Royal Mail Scottish First Book of the Year Award for Amande’s Bed;believes that this book marks an important milestone in promoting the dialects and languages of Scotland and in enriching Scotland’s culture, and believes that Scottish literary works should be encouraged, promoted and protected from big business interests which undermine diversity and lead to the encroachment of a monoculture. Supported by: Frances Curran, Tommy Sheridan, Richard Lochhead, Colin Fox, Rosie Kane, Chris Ballance, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Jim Wallace, Michael Matheson, Linda Fabiani*
S2M-3680 Congratulations to John Aberdein (lodged on 6 December 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*
